page.title: 15B.W.I. CofE. SCHOOL RUISLIP
page.content: I go to a school called ( Bishop Winnington Ingram School.) It has six infant and six junior classes.The headmaster of the school is called Mr. D. Knowles. There are 6 infant, 6 junior and 3 part time teachers. There are 370 pupils. The infants are from 5-7 years and the juniors from 7-11 years. Infants usually have to start half time. It is a state school. As well as the usual education children learn how to use computers. B.W.I. was first built in Eastcote Road on the site of an older school known as the Ruislip Church of England School.On July 15th 1931 it was dedicated by the Bishop of London Dr. Arthur Winnington-Ingram. The new school in Southcote Rise was opened in September 1968. In 1981 the school celebrated its golden jubilee.
